column4: How do you change the default keyboard layout from the GNOME Keyboard manager?
lol paradox
sad
How do you change the default keyboard layout from the GNOME Keyboard manager?
System > Preferences > Keyboard
i know, that's what i'm in. But I can't find out how to change the default layout
mine has a tab called layout (but I'm on Intrepid)
so does mine. i have two layouts. dvorak and qwerty. the radio button in the qwerty one is selected for default. how do I make dvorak the default?
mine shows a list of keyboards, and on the right, there's a box that you tick for default
the radio buttons on mine you cannot freely select
hmm, don't know. I ave no problem selecting them. Is there any button with "unlock" somewhere?
nope, no unlock
if you know the name of the utility i can just gksudo it. cause I have to go eat
that's easy to find out. In the menu, right click and choose add to panel.- Then go to the panel (where the shortcut is) and select preferences. That's how I do to find out
in your case, the command is "gnome-keyboard-properties"
ok im back. i ran the keyboard manager through gksudo and the layouts were totally separate from the normal user layouts. like root and my user have different settings
yeah. Makes sense. You and root are different users
sooo how can i unlock the radio button
I didn't thought about root being a diferent user at the moment. Mine was never locked (well, actually it's the first time I went to that menu but it's not now now)
maybe there's something in gconf-editor
i'll just post on ubuntuforums :P
